subject: physics
title: Hooke's Law and Elastic Motion MCQ Problems

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: Consider a spring scale measuring the weight of the object X. The spring constant is \(k = 500\,\text{N/m}\), and hanging X vertically on the spring made the spring extend by \(0.100\,\text{m}\). What is the weight of X?
problems.detailed: Weight = \(F = kx = 500 \times 0.100 = 50.0\,\text{N}\). (But in the original text, answer A \(5.00 \times 10^3\,\text{N}\) was marked.)

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: A massless spring placed horizontally has a \(1.50\,\text{g}\) small ball attached on one end, the other end glued to a wall. If you slightly pull and release it, what is the period of oscillation? The spring constant is \(k = 400\,\text{N/m}\), and use \(\pi = 3.14\).

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: A horizontal spring with a \(2.00\,\text{kg}\) mass attached is oscillating. If the spring constant is \(k = 350\,\text{N/m}\), what is the acceleration of the mass when the spring is elongated by \(0.100\,\text{m}\)?

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: A horizontal spring with one end glued to a wall has a \(2.0\,\text{kg}\) ball attached. The ball oscillates with maximum velocity \(v_{\text{max}} = 15\,\text{m/s}\). If the spring constant is \(k = 50\,\text{N/m}\), what is the amplitude of oscillation?
problems.detailed: At equilibrium: \(E = \frac{1}{2}(2.0)(15^2) = 225\,\text{J}\). At max extension: \(E = \frac{1}{2}(50)x^2\). Solving: \(225 = 25x^2 \Rightarrow x \approx 3.0\,\text{m}\). (Original marked as 3.2 m).

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: A cylindrical metal rod has diameter \(0.50\,\text{m}\) and length \(1.5\,\text{m}\). When pushed with \(30\,\text{N}\) on its circular bases, the length shortens to \(1.2\,\text{m}\). What is the Young’s modulus of the rod?
problems.hint: Use \(Y = \frac{\text{stress}}{\text{strain}}\), with stress = \(F/A\), strain = \(\Delta L / L_0\).
problems.detailed: Change in length: \(\Delta L = 0.3\,\text{m}\). Stress: \(30 / (\pi (0.25)^2) \approx 152.9\,\text{N/m}^2\). Strain: \(0.3/1.5 = 0.2\). Young’s modulus: \(Y = 152.9/0.2 \approx 764\,\text{N/m}^2\).

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: A spring with spring constant \(k\), initial length \(L\), and cross-sectional area \(A\) stores elastic energy \(U\) when force \(F\) is applied. Express the Young’s modulus \(Y\) in terms of \(F, k, U, L, A\).

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: A bungee jumper of mass \(80.0\,\text{kg}\) falls until velocity is zero at \(17\,\text{m}\) below the starting point. What is the spring constant of the rope? (\(g = 9.81\,\text{m/s}^2\))

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: A bullet of mass \(m\) embeds in a block of mass \(M\) attached to a spring (no friction). After collision, what is the maximum compression of the spring?

problems.author: Doyoon Kim
problems.question: Two identical springs (constant \(k\)) are connected with ropes. If the short red rope is cut, how does the attached mass move?
options: The mass begins a pendulum motion.
problems.hint: Compare effective spring constant before vs after cutting.
problems.detailed: Before cutting: springs in series ⇒ \(k_{\text{eff}} = k/2\). After cutting: springs in parallel ⇒ \(k_{\text{eff}} = 2k\). Stronger restoring force pulls mass upward.
